task_summary: A robot arm places a teapot onto the stove by performing perception, grasping, transfer, and releasing actions, as documented in the provided episode contact sheet.

task_long_description.overview: The episode shows a robot arm in a kitchen environment executing a sequence to place a metal teapot onto the stove surface. Key objects are the teapot and the stove, both visually distinct and easily localizable. The robot uses perception to detect the teapot, approaches and grasps it securely, then moves over the stove and releases the teapot onto the target area. The process includes safety and precision constraints: gentle force for grasping and accurate positioning over the stove. Failure recovery is managed by repeated perceptual scans and post-release retreat. The sequence is fully visualized in the frames, and the robot performs the final placement and detachment efficiently.
preconditions: Teapot is present on a surface accessible to the robot
Stove area is clear and reachable
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the teapot and scan if needed
Move above the teapot and compute grasp pose
Approach and align gripper with teapot; lower until contact
Close gripper to grasp teapot and verify stability
Check visibility of the stove and detect if necessary
Place teapot on stove surface and release
success_criteria: Teapot is placed stably and upright on the stove
Gripper is detached from the teapot and returns to safe position
No collision or dropped object during transfer
failure_and_recovery: Object not visible: Scan with fallback
Grasp unstable: Retry approach and grasp or abort
Placement imprecise: Reattempt above placement threshold
task_long_description.termination: Terminated when the teapot is confirmed placed on the stove and the robot has retreated

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Place the teapot on the stove

node_specs.description: Checks if the teapot is visible to robot sensors.
Performs a raster scan to find the teapot when not detected.
Detects and localizes the teapot position.
Opens the gripper to an appropriate width before grasp.
Positions gripper above the teapot to prepare for grasp.
Computes the grasp pose using side strategy for teapot.
Approaches and aligns the gripper to the teapot with tight tolerance.
Lowers gripper gently onto teapot until contact at low force.
Closes the gripper with gentle force to grasp the teapot.
Checks for stable grasp of the teapot.
Checks if the stove is visible.
Detects the stove's position if not already visible.
Moves the teapot above the stove to align for placement.
Places the teapot gently on the stove surface.
Opens the gripper to release the teapot.
Retreats the gripper away from teapot after placement.

recovery_strategy: Use repeated scans for missing objects
assumptions: Visual evidence confirms single teapot and stove present
Teapot is not already on stove in frame_0, so grasp and transfer are required
Instruction matches frames; no fundamental conflicts

expected_success_criteria: Teapot is securely and stably positioned on the stove
No signs of collision or object falling
